text:
Station tracks where possible were used for access and reconnaissance 
 and 2 visits were made to the ground. 
 The tracks are very rugged and in some places are not visible due to the 
 long canegrass and during and just after the wet season inaccessible. 
 Some of the tracks become visible only after fires - due to bushfires 
 burning off the canegrass. 
 Some of the old tracks have been rutted out due to the heavy wet seasonal 
 There were 3 visits during the reporting period.

text:
Wamex tenement summary is attached for item 251A. 
 Item 251a covers the years between 1963 – 1973. 
 Our diamond exploration consultant prepared a report on the diamond 
 potential and other minerals potential for the Wilson river project. 
 Copies of the CD’s for these reports are included in the attachments. 
 Whilst geologist Vince Roberts did not undertake field visits, consultant 
 Graham A Hawks did on three occasions.

potential for gold. 
 About 11 sq km of the Whitewater Volcanics unit are associated with the 
 substantial Greenvale Fault system in the project area. 
 This combination indicates potential for uranium, base metal and precious 
 metal mineralization. 
 There have been occurrences of tin near the south boundary of EL 
 Also two relatively small occurrences of gabbro-norite are within the 
 project area and require investigation of their nickel copper potential as 
 suggested by geologist Vince Roberts in his report on other minerals in 
 the project area.

7.text: Most of this project area covers granitic type rocks which show potential

8.text: for alluvial diamonds as well as uranium and possibly gold.

10.text: Generally more than 9 km of strike length of a sequence of Tungary

11.text: Formation sediments and intrusive sills of Hart Dolerite are demonstrated

text:
Most of this project area covers granitic type rocks which show potential 
 for alluvial diamonds as well as uranium and possibly gold. 
 Generally more than 9 km of strike length of a sequence of Tungary 
 Formation sediments and intrusive sills of Hart Dolerite are demonstrated

7.text: The site visits incorporated a reconnoiter survey program over the large

8.text: area covered by the lease.  Due to the rugged terrain it was proposed that

9.text: sampling be taken after the reconnaissance work and most likely in year

10.text: two. 11 sites have been selected covering much of the ground.

text:
The site visits incorporated a reconnoiter survey program over the large 
 area covered by the lease.  Due to the rugged terrain it was proposed that 
 sampling be taken after the reconnaissance work and most likely in year 
 two. 11 sites have been selected covering much of the ground.

text:
The two occurrences of tin are to be inspected for their potential near the 
 south boundary of EL 80/3462 to see if the ground has similar settings 
 within the project area. 
 The gabbro-norite is to be ground inspected whilst our field team is in the 
 vicinity to check for any indication of surface mineralization or of 
 magnetic or relatively ultramafic variations. 
 The field team is expected to be in the area August to September 2007. 
 These recommendations are as suggested by our consultant geologist
